reviews.review_msg: Awesome

The class is difficult if you know nothing about geog. Must attend the classes to fill in the blank in lectures notes. Lecture notes are enough for theory questions, but there are something like drawing maps in final, which is unexpected because it's different from midterm. Thus, skimming the textbook is a good idea to prepare to the final

I took him in both GEOG102 and 111. He usually speaks monotone so the lectures might be boring but he really cares students alot and wants all students to get satisfied grade. He is very kind and generous to all students. Midterms might hard but final is very easy. Be sure to go lecture because he gives hints on midterm and final.

Faran is good at explaining but the material itself was boring for me. Tests were fair, may need to read the textbook though if you don't catch up everything. Other than that, everything you need for B grade range is lecture slides. Make sure that you know how  to complete assignments they will be in the final paper.
fun, except for tutorials

Faran is a very nice teacher who wants his students to succeed. However, his lectures are quite dry and most of the exam questions were quite trivial to what was discussed in class. There are weekly readings to do and discuss for tutorials as well and a good portion of your marks depend on your participation in those discussions.

Faran is very passionate about the material and about helping his students! He would even attend lab sections to assist students. If you go to lectures, there should be no surprises for the final exam. He also was extremely generous in providing practice questions and labs for the midterm and final! Very interesting material!

Content is interesting, but he makes the lectures dry and rambles on forever. Some of his exam questions are pretty random, based on things he barely touched on in class, but if you memorize all the lecture notes and diagrams you should be good
The class is the most boring thing I've done in my undergrad, but Faran is a good teacher.
Super nice guy. His lectures can be a little dry, but the content is easy and interesting. Definitely cares about his subject and his students! The textbook is definitely not needed though.
Very easy class. Studied for final day before and finished with an A-.

His lectures are very clear and informative. He genuinely cares if you do well or not. As for tutorials, I had a TA who can't speak and explain in English very well so it it wasn't as good as Ali's lectures. Grading scheme is also lenient which helps a lot. 10/10 would take again.

I took Geog 102 with Faran for my first semester of university and it was awesome! Super caring prof, wants students to do well, and gives good info in the lectures. One lecture he asked us if we wanted an extension on the assignment and we all said yes, so he said okay you all get another week!! What a great prof!! Would recommend!

Had no trouble understanding his lectures and he often repeats key points to make sure you hear it. Exams are based on his slides, not the textbook. You feel thrown into the labs and it would be helpful if some instruction for the lab material was provided. Ask for help. Really great information in this course and lucked out with an exceptional TA.

Lecture were long and dry. Labs were straightforward at the beginning, but got more difficult towards the end. Go to the lectures as some of the notes are left out of the posted powerpoint slides. It's a pretty easy class as long as you study the lecture notes.
He is nice, but his lectures are long and boring. There are blanks to fill, so attendance is mandatory. Labs, midterm, especially final exam are all difficult...
boring lectures, expect lab work every week, tough exams.

This class was super dull and boring. I had high hopes from the other ratings on here, however it involved a lot of math and science, and I would not recommend for non-science students. He was an okay prof, but hard to understand and read off the slides. Also was not understanding of unforeseen circumstances. Wouldn't recommend this class.
boring

Professor Ali was amazing. Essays were marked tough but overall fair. He is the best prof ever. Midterm was a little challenging but the Final was a piece of cake. Would take a class with Professor Ali again.
Faran is a great prof. Though he might not be clear at times but you can always visit him during his office hours and he will make sure you understand the matter. Overall he is a good prof.

Took geog 102 with him for socials breadth and was very easy.  Two essays, a small presentation and a midterm and final was the class.  Lots of things taught seem intuitive although learn the specific lists he wants you to know and you're golden.  Lectures were dry but weren't the worst.  Seems like a nice enough guy.  TAs for the class were cool.

He is very clear in what he expects from you. Two essays and a midterm along with the final exam. One presentation for tutorial as well. Marking rubric is very clear, and if you do your studying the exams are fairly easy. He is always available for extra help. The textbook saved me for the two essays, I based my entire papers off the textbook.

Professor Ali is very detail-oriented and organized in terms of notes and assignment instructions. He enjoys the material and encourages questions during lectures. The subject is quite dry and requires a lot of memorization. Midterm was challenging compared to the easy final. Participation in tutorial is essential to doing well in the course.

Very clear and organized prof - not the greatest course in the whole world but he definitely takes the time to answer your questions and help you if you attend office hours. The tests were pretty tough so you have to study quite a bit. Good prof but not so good course
nice person. exams are long. go to lecture as he doesn't post all the notes on Canvas. the class requires the usual amount of work. You will do well if you are good at memorizing things
if you are not a fan of math, DO NOT TAKE THIS COURSE

Super easy course. The exams were easy if you go through all the material and you could get through the labs without putting in much effort. The instructor isn't very clear, but is very considerate and approachable! Would love to take another class with this professor!
Super boring class!!!

I am taking both GEOG 102 and GEOG 111 with Faran. GEOG 102 (World Problems) is by far the most interesting course I have ever taken, and GEOG 111 is a must for understanding Earth Systems. I am satisfied with both the courses. Very organized, knowledgeable and caring prof, great lecture notes, and very fair tests. I did very well on both midterms.

I am taking both GEOG 102 and GEOG 111 with Faran Ali. GEOG 102 (World Problems) is by far the most interesting course I have ever taken, and GEOG 111 is a must for understanding Earth Systems. I am more than satisfied with both the courses. Very organized, knowledgeable and caring prof, great lecture notes, and very fair tests. Actually, I did ver

He add red notes onto his lecture slides that he does not put on the slides on Canvas (online)forcing you to attend his long, dry, and boring lecture to get all the information needed for the exams. Tutorial are next to useless, you are required to do only 1 presentation throughout the semester, yet you still have to attend for attendance grading (5%).

Easy Prof.  Long slides, he high lights 23 of the lecture slides . Attendance is not mandatory, he uploads the slides online. Study the slides and you will pass. There is a easy group presentation 10-15 minutes. Although sometimes hard to follow him because he mumbles. Overall easy class with easy prof.

The lectures are so boring and sometime not clear, but it doesn't matter because this course is fairly easy. As many people said before, this course is a GPA booster. The only one thing i don't like is that there is lots of work to do in the labs. After all, an easy A to me
GREAT PROF. Very clear lecture notes, fair tests and interesting lab assignments. Mid-term mean 73% (B); Highest mark 99%; a sure GPA booster!

The two hour lectures feel like they go on for days. He is a good professor but can be quite boring. The content is easy if you do the lab assignments and do the textbook readings. The exams are fair and there are no surprises. Do the assignments and have basic understanding of the lecture notes and you will probably get a B or higher.
Will be taking my third course with Faran this spring. One of my favorite and the most caring prof in Geography.
BORING, UNCLEAR, LET ME FEEL SLEEPY
Pretty easy but boring class. He pretty much just reads from the slides, aside from the rare "not in the notes" point here and there. Labs are very time consuming, but not difficult.
Slightly boring prof, a lot of work to be finished in lab but other than that the class is a gpa booster.
Very nice prof. One of my favorites! Thank you Dr. Ali for making Geography so fun!!!

Very clear with what would be on the exams, but the assignments were a little all over the place. He would give very short descriptions and then take off marks for things that were not in the assignment outlines. I would still recommend taking the course with him, just go visit him frequently and know exactly what he wants from you.
His class is pretty easy with 2 essays, a midterm and a final. The content is easy to grasp and lectures can be boring at times. He has a pretty heavy accent. No textbook needed.
So incredibly kind, genuinely cares for students. Exams = more than fair. Just the best professor SFU has ever had.
Faran is a very good prof. Hes accent is interesting but very easy to get by and understand him. He is very helpful if you seek help from him and his tests are extremely fair.

About to take my third class with Faran and I have to say, he is the best prof I have had at SFU. His accent is something that is easy to look past. His expectations are clear, and it is not hard to do well in his class if you put in some effort. One of the most understanding and caring professors I have met. Will continue to take courses with him.
His class avarage is B so if you are looking for B without working hard, take a class with him, he is a really nice and kind prof
Good prof
Take his class if you want a good grade
Not very clear when he give lecture but everything he says is writen in the slides so you even don't need to go to class
Would take a class with him again
Hard to understand him at times but overall great class.
an easy A or B class,, recommend it
I like this prof
great man
an easy course, the prof is not very clear but his sildes has everything
ignore what other said, he is simply very nice and kind prof, who care about his student. English his 2nd language that why he is no perfect in English. Overall, you could understand him
He is willing to re-mark you paper, exam. they only prof I ever seen so far at SFU, care about his students to get really good grades. I will take a course with him again. Really best prof at SFU

very very nice and kind prof. he do want every one of his student to get a good grade and willing& welcoming  to re-mark each assignment. Most of the time he will give good grades. the best prof at sfu

Trys his best to clarify what's gonna be tested and what's not. Don't need the textbook, as the you'll only be tested based on what's on the lecture slides. Attendance is not required, but does help. Overall it's a good course, fairly easy. Put in some effort and should be an easy A. Highly recommend this prof and this course.
Mid terms are fair. its basically all from the lecture slides. 2 assignments in the course, fairly easy topics! Easy elective

GEOG 102 (World Problems) is is an interesting and eye-opening overview to the world's current environmental problems. Faran is a real nice prof, always friendly and ready to help.  There are just two assignments and the tutorials are fun with useful discussions. Everybody passed the mid-term. I would recommend this course.

extremely hard to understand, the lectures are boring and hard to stay concentrated in. Exams have questions irrelevant to course material and the labs are very hard. would not recommend if you do not have a background in the subject.

I have found GEOG 111 very useful in understanding different aspects of earth-atmosphere system. Lecture notes are superb and the online course guide very helpful. Today's all multiple choice mid-term was very fair and thoughtfully prepared. Labs are interesting.

Geog111 is a fairly easy course. Attendance isn't necessary, but it does help. The labs are a free 25%. Don't listen to people that say it's hard; It's basic math equations. The midterm was very fair and had no surprises. I got 55/60. The difficulty level of the course is not high. Reading the textbook and doing online quizzes was sufficient.
Doesn't look like a 1st year course at all!! I feel like at least 2nd/3rd year, especially when you don't have the background knowledge about the course material.

Read and memorize all the modules, diagrams, and lecture notes.Labs are very difficult, but doable if you have a good TA. Lectures were read off powerpoint word for word.Can't understand what he's saying 80% of the time so I guess it's good that it's all on pp.
Not an easy teacher to understand. Lectures were dry and the homework was way harder than anything he taught or what was in the readings.

This class definitely has some interesting topics, but lectures are boring and dry. Prof mostly reads off the lectures slides, with not much additional information on them. Textbook is absolutely useless, no need for it.

This class is definitely interesting to me, but the lectures were useless. He read off of the powerpoints (and that was when you could understand him). Very easy class though, textbook is not needed. Just read his lecture notes and you'll be set.
This course is watered down and useless - I got the notes from a previous course and compare. I regret taking this course!!
I like him. He's a super nice guy. His test and labs are manageable. No crazy expectations. I'd take one of his courses again.
Yawn!!!! The prof does not show enthusiasm for the material. To top it off, he is not able to explain the materials well. Regret taking this course but it is compulsory for me.
Seems ok but dull and boring style of presentation. I am afraid the way this course is taught I will not be well prepared for advanced studies in this area. I will avoid courses taught by this prof.
